metadata.synopsis: After the player arrives at Nightsong's prison in the Shadowfell we see Balthazar show up, hot on the player's heels. Balthazar makes his way down towards Nightsong. Variant lines for:1. Met Balthazar in person, agreed to help2. Met Balthazar in person, didn't agree to help 3. Fallback (likely skipped meeting Balthazar)If Balthazar is dead then the player is just shown a cinematic shot of the Shadowfell

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *The Shadowfell. Never before have you found yourself so close to Lady Shar's embrace. The fulfilment of her command is so close now. You must allow nothing to stop you.*

53.speaker: Shadowheart
53.text: Lady Shar... I can feel her all around. This is her domain. This is the Shadowfell.

22.speaker: Balthazar
22.text: You did well - better than I would have credited you with. Now hurry along and bear witness to my masterpiece.
22.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react, InternalNodeContext: Player met Balthazar in person and agreed to helpNodeContext: High-handed, pleased with himself

42.speaker: Balthazar
42.text: I knew you would do my bidding - even though you pretended otherwise.
42.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react, InternalNodeContext: Player met Balthazar in person and didn't agree to helpNodeContext: High-handed, pleased with himself

59.speaker: Balthazar
59.text: You cleared the way for me, True Soul. What promising flesh you are. As a reward, I shall let you bear witness to my masterpiece.
59.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react, InternalNodeContext: Fallback - haven't met balthazar in person or agreed to helpNodeContext: High-handed, pleased with himself

1.speaker: Balthazar
1.text: What, lost for words? I've been known to have that effect on underlings. Come and join me if you survive the descent - but do not interfere.
1.context: NodeContext: Reacting to the player's inability to respond (they've been muted)

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *This creature does not belong here in the Dark Lady's sacred realm. He could ruin your chance to prove yourself to her.*

0.speaker: Balthazar
0.text: My name is Balthazar, trusted advisor of General Ketheric Thorm. Surely he spoke of me if he sent you to my aid.

51.speaker: Balthazar
51.text: I had been trying to reach this place, to retrieve something of great value. And thanks to you, the path is unblocked. Bravo.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I was hoping for something more substantial than 'thanks'.

45.speaker: Balthazar
45.text: Very well, then. My sincere thanks.

16.speaker: Balthazar
16.text: Don't be so mercenary - General Thorm's approval is worth more than any mere bauble.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I'm here for my own reasons - not because of you.

3.speaker: Balthazar
3.text: Oh, look, they think they have free will. How darling.

8.speaker: Balthazar
8.text: Now get on with it. Try not to lose your footing. I'd hate to see good flesh wasted on a long fall into oblivion.

21.speaker: Balthazar
21.text: Simple - I followed you. It seems Shar still holds a grudge against General Thorm, and so sought to prevent me from entering in his name.

24.speaker: Balthazar
24.text: Luckily, you were the perfect agent in helping me slip past her defences. Now the Nightsong is within reach.

14.speaker: Balthazar
14.text: How kind of you to do so exactly as I ordered you to, even after you refused. You're a better pawn than you claim to be.
14.context: InternalNodeContext: this node only NodeContext: Patronising

43.speaker: Balthazar
43.text: Simple - I followed you. It seems Shar bears a grudge against my master, General Thorm, and so sought to prevent me from entering in his name.

27.speaker: Balthazar
27.text: The Shadowfell - or at least a little pocket of it, repurposed to house the Nightsong.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: What's stopping me from just killing you and taking the Nightsong for myself?

41.speaker: Player
41.text: What's stopping me from just killing you and taking this relic for myself?

2.speaker: Balthazar
2.text: Your lack of ability, perhaps? You made for an adequate errand-runner thus far, but let's not overstate your virtues.

31.speaker: Balthazar
31.text: Raise one finger to me and I'd sunder you like lightning would a rotten oak. Now enough dullard questions - follow me.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Quite an elaborate set-up. Is the Nightsong truly worth it?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Quite an elaborate set-up. Is the relic truly worth it?

62.speaker: Balthazar
62.text: There is not a shadow of a doubt. But don't take my word for it. Come. See for yourself.
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You still haven't explained just who the hells you are.

46.speaker: Balthazar
46.text: Balthazar. Trusted advisor to General Thorm, and your better in every measure. Now enough questions - follow me.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

20.speaker: Player
20.text: How did you even get here?

56.speaker: Balthazar
56.text: Gladly. And once proceedings begin, please show some wits and do not interfere.
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

32.speaker: Balthazar
32.text: The Shadowfell - or at least a little pocket of it, repurposed to house the relic.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Your thanks buy very little - I prefer to be paid in coin. Lots of it.

28.speaker: Balthazar
28.text: You think any coin or bauble can be more valuable than General Thorm's favour? Temper your greed.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I cleared the way to this place, not you. Why shouldn't I just kill you instead of letting you interfere?

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: This is the Dark Lady's domain - he does not belong here.
54.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player re: Balthazar. Disdain.

64.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player is shown a vista of the Shadowfell to set up the region
